comments.body:
If it is not required, you don't need to state `required: False`. That's implicit.
It is easier to see which parameters are required if those only have `required: True`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +41,45 @@    - This works by C(dependency_action) to either add/remove or set the
      services in this list.
    required: False
    version_added: "2.3"
  dependency_action:

comments.body: should this be a yaml list instead, same with the other changes below?

This is also a valid YAML list, both are possible.
I am not in favor to mandate using the expanded (multi-line) format.
In fact I think there's merit here in switching between both syntaxes in subsequent examples.
Fair enough, I do prefer the yaml format but that's a personal opinion, having both is a + for me.

I'll put this on the list of things to discuss in the Documentation WG.
To me, the documentation examples serve a few purposes:
- Demonstrate possible ways to use the module first and foremost
- Show good practices (like always using `name:`)
- Learn possible constructs/syntax in YAML (e.g. like showing both YAML and JSON style lists)
- Learn possible constructs/syntax in Ansible (where useful add loops constructs or demonstrate registering output)
- Do not give wrong impressions (by using a minimalistic YAML syntax, e.g. indentation, quoting)

cc @acozine

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +209,213 @@  win_service:
    name: service name
    dependencies: [ service1, service2 ]

- name: Add dependencies to existing dependencies
